text: Question 15 Let G be a simple undirected graph. Let TD be a depth first search tree of G. Let TB be a breadth first search tree of G. Consider the following statements. () No edge of G is a cross edge with respect to TD. (A cross edge in G is between two nodes neither of which is an ancestor of the other in TD.) (Il) For every edge (u,v) of G, if uis at depth i and v is at depth j in TB, then |i-j|=1. Which of the statements above must necessarily be true? e lonly e Il only Q Both land Il Q Neither | nor Il GATE CSE 2018 Discrete Mathematics
